summary:
Elmer Mesman graduated at Hogere Hotelschool Leeuwarden in 1996. With his clear passion for aviation and after a brief stint in Hotel Management and acquisition, he pursued his interest by joining Qantas Airways Ltd. in September the same year. Based in the Netherlands responsible for the Benelux sales region his career within Qantas transferred from roles like Field Sales Representative, Sales & Marketing Manager to his last role of Commercial Manager Benelux, Germany, Switzerland and Austria. 
Always having the ambition to represent an ‘online’ airline brand of high standard, he took the opportunity to join Singapore Airlines in January 2023. As Sales Manager he is mapping out the sales strategy for the Benelux together with his local team. During his the 27 years of service within the aviation industry, he also fulfilled external aviation related roles like president of the Dutch Passenger Airline Sales Representatives Association (PASRA), an industry related association with 54 different member-airlines. 
Besides his professional career within Singapore Airlines he is a freelance journalist travelling the world for several sorts of media ranging from sports, travel to historical publications. His fascination with aviation, WWII and Australia for example brought him to the Northern Territory to explore all the sites and traces of Dutch wartime influences, with No.18 NEI Squadron being one of them as main topic. The Katherine Historical Society in Australia released his publication on No. 18 NEI Squadron as part of their Book ‘The Territory at War’.

company.name: Children of 18 Squadron NEI - RAAF Foundation

profile_positions.company: Children of 18 Squadron NEI - RAAF Foundation
profile_positions.description:
The 18 sqn NEI - RAAF Foundation was founded in 2017 with one mission: ‘Lest we forget’ 
The nonprofit foundation is driven by the goal to remember the Dutch and Australian Airmen defending Australia and the former Netherlands East Indies during the WWII and shortly afterwards in the 18th Squadron for freedom, Queen and Country.
The foundation has several objectives to achieve its goal; 
Organizing an annual reunion
Developing a platform for sharing information
Unlocking database and libraries worldwide about the 18th Squadron                                       Providing information related to the 18th Sqn. on request                                                          Publishing newsletters, articles, and press releases
Maintaining international relations regarding the 18th Squadron
profile_positions.title: Board Member

profile_positions.description:
The Airline Express is an annual trade workshop event organised by PASRA (Passenger Airline Sales Represenatives Association) held in  March & April each year in 7 different regions in the Netherlands. 24 Airlines participates in this roadshow. The workshops are held after office hours and attended by front line agency staff representing 300 agencies & touroperators. Average attendance is 150 front line staff per evening. The event held since 1990 and intiated by Qantas, offers the airlines an unique opportunity to sit down face-to-face with 1,000 front line staff during 7 workshop sessions/evenings.
The 6 hour event is hosted by moderator Elmer Mesman since 2005 together with the board of PASRA itself.
profile_positions.title: Moderator

profile_positions.description: PASRA is a professional organization for the benefit of Sales Representatives and Sales Managers of Passenger Airlines based or represented in the Netherlands. The aim of the organization is to maintain and possibly improve the mutual contacts between the Sales Representatives, Sales Executives and Sales Managers of the various airlines. The organization also aims to keep its members informed about developments in tourism in general and developments in aviation in particular.
profile_positions.title: President
